summary: The document is a secret memorandum from the FBI to the Director, dated March 1, 1963, concerning Angela Prince Moutsos. It details her departure from New York to Havana, Cuba, on December 31, 1960, to join her husband, Pedros Moutsos, and mentions her husband's association with a CIA source as of June 1985. The FBI requests the CIA to provide any information regarding her activities and residence in Cuba. The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: Angela Prince Moutsos traveled to Cuba to join her husband, Pedros Moutsos, in 1960.
Pedros Moutsos was associated with a CIA source as of June 1985.
The FBI sought CIA's assistance in gathering information on Angela Prince Moutsos's activities and residence in Cuba.
The document was classified as 'Secret' and was last reviewed on September 28, 1998.
